I've realized that there is a TH/THC backend for dist, and it seems redundant if we declare a native function like this:

Tensor dist(const Tensor& src, const Tensor& dest, Scalar p) {
  return at::norm(src - dest, p);
}

What is impeding this kind of a definition?

@zou3519 I also checked the code for 0-norm (there is a special case), and it seems to be correct.
